question.problem: The reaction of hydrocarbons with oxygen to produce carbon dioxide, water and heat is called: W) fission X) fusion Y) endothermic Z) combustion
What is the only known substance for which there is no triple point:
What is the name of the device that is made by combining two basic types of solid state rectifiers allowing the device to both rectify and amplify a current?

Which of the following was one of the first direct indications that the speed of light could not be exceeded: W) Faradays law of induction X) Einsteins theory of Special Relativity Y) the Lorentz-Fitzgerald contraction Z) Plancks constant
question.solution: Y) THE LORENTZ-FITZGERALD CONTRACTION Sample Round Robin Page 1

question.problem: An example of negative feedback control is when: W) the end product of a metabolic pathway inhibits an earlier reaction X) the initial enzyme of a metabolic pathway inhibits a later reaction Y) the end product of a metabolic pathway stimulates an earlier reaction Z) the initial product of a metabolic pathway inhibits the next reaction
question.solution: W) THE END PRODUCT OF A METABOLIC PATHWAY INHIBITS AN EARLIER REACTION

question.problem: What is the name of the inner surface of the myocardium that is lined with a layer of endothelial cells?

The hydrogen envelope that surrounds the comets nucleus derives its hydrogen most directly from: W) gases escaping from the melting comets ice X) hydrogen captured from interstellar space Y) breakdown of water by ultraviolet light Z) hydrogen in the solar winds
question.solution: Y) BREAKDOWN OF WATER BY ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT

question.problem: What do Astronomers call the point in the sky that is directly overhead?
Which of the following does NOT yield a periodic non-terminating decimal: W) 5/6 X) 1/27 Y) 1/18 Z) 7/8
What 3 consecutive numbers add up to 45?

Which is the best reason for proposing that a boulder lying in an area that was once glaciated is an erratic: W) it is of a different composition than the underlying rock X) it is rounded and worn Y) it is larger than any surrounding rocks Z) it is located near a glacial lake
question.solution: W) IT IS OF A DIFFERENT COMPOSITION THAN THE UNDERLYING ROCK

question.problem: What is the term for groundwater emerging naturally at the ground surface, where the water table intersects the surface:
question.solution: SPRING (ACCEPT: SEEP) Sample Round Robin Page 3

question.problem: Which of the following is most specifically designed to measure low temperatures: W) alcohol thermometer X) pyrometer Y) cryometer Z) mercury thermometer
Who was the first president of the International Psychoanalysis Association who theorized that the shadow archetype consists of animal instincts:

A tropical storm will be declared a hurricane when: W) there is evidence of eye formation X) wind speeds reach 64 mph Y) wind gusts are in excess of 74 mph Z) there is evidence of eye formation and sustained wind speeds of 74 mph
question.solution: Z) THERE IS EVIDENCE OF EYE FORMATION AND SUSTAINED WIND SPEEDS OF 74 MPH

question.problem: What kind of rocks are formed by the lithification of sediments:
question.solution: SEDIMENTARY ROCKS Sample Round Robin Page 4

question.problem: The ideal fuel for fuel cell use is: W) compressed natural gas X) reformulated gasoline Y) hydrogen Z) methanol
What is the branch of chemistry that deals with the relationship between electricity and chemical reactions?

Which of the following is NOT a consequence of the theory of electromagnetic radiation as formulated by J. C. Maxwell: W) electric fields can cause magnetic disturbance X) electromagnetic radiation consists of an electric and magnetic wave Y) light is a form of electromagnetic radiation Z) bright red light ejects no electrons from a metallic surface whereas dim violet light can
question.solution: Z) BRIGHT RED LIGHT EJECTS NO ELECTRONS FROM A METALLIC SURFACE WHEREAS DIM VIOLET LIGHT CAN

question.problem: All elements with an atomic number greater than what number are unstable?
Mendel did most of his original experimentation using this type of plant:
Order the following from the part of the digestive tract nearest to the beginning to the part nearest to the end: jejunum, ileum, esophagus, duodenum
A meteor that reaches the surface of the Earth is more accurately called a:

At a location half-way from the Equator to the North Pole, which of the following correctly describes the stars apparent motion: W) they move in circles parallel with the horizon X) they rise and set vertically Y) they remain stationary Z) they rise and set at an angle to the horizon
question.solution: Z) THEY RISE AND SET AT AN ANGLE TO THE HORIZON Sample Round Robin Page 6

question.problem: In a simple random sample: W) response bias will be small X) non-response bias will be small Y) any two samples of the same size will have the same chance of being drawn Z) each subject is asked every question and random responses are allowed
question.solution: Y) ANY TWO SAMPLES OF THE SAME SIZE WILL HAVE THE SAME CHANCE OF BEING DRAWN

question.problem: Every even integer greater than 2 can be written as the sum of two primes. Give the respective two pairs of prime numbers that when added give 8 and 12:
question.solution: 5 AND 3 FOR THE NUMBER 8; AND 7 AND 5 FOR THE NUMBER 12 [Note: 11 and 1 is not an acceptable answer; 1 is not a prime number]

question.problem: What is the professional name for the person who studies fossils?
Which of the following latitudes and dates would coincide with the longest duration of insolation: W) 23 South on September 21 X) 50 North on June 21 Y) 50 South on March 21 Z) 0 on June 21
question.solution: X) 50 NORTH ON JUNE 21 (Solution: W=12 hrs; X=15 hrs; Y= 12 hrs; Z=12 hrs) Sample Round Robin Page 7

question.problem: In the tempering of steel tools, the process of rapidly cooling the tool is called: W) quickening X) quenching Y) drawing Z) case hardening
What is the general name of the unusual infectious agents that causes spongiform (pronounced: SPONGE-ih-form) encephalopathy (pronounced: EN-seff-a-lop-o-thee)?
Which of the following planets has the highest escape velocity: W) Saturn X) Uranus Y) Jupiter Z) Mars
Which moon is the only other body in our solar system, besides the Earth, that has an atmosphere of mostly nitrogen?
Out of the following choices, which is the correct name for N2O3: W) dinitrogen oxide X) dinitrogen dioxide Y) dinitrogen trioxide Z) dinitrogen tetroxide
Convert 673 Kelvin into degrees centigrade:
In stars, the fusion of hydrogen typically releases energy as: W) photons and friction X) photons and neutrinos Y) photons and mesons Z) photons and gravitons
Assuming friction is negligible, if a lever has a mechanical advantage of 5, how much effort in newtons is needed to lift a 10 newton load?
question.solution: 2 NEWTONS ( Solution: Force = resistance / mechanical advantage ) Sample Round Robin Page 9

question.problem: Which of the following is the term for when a segment of a chromosome rotates 180 degrees and rejoins the same chromosome: W) deletion X) inversion Y) translocation Z) duplication
Germs that cause fever usually act on this section of the brain, which is sometimes referred to as the bodys thermostat:
Light from distant galaxies comes mostly from which of the following: W) low mass stars X) high mass stars Y) ionized hydrogen nebula Z) large globular clusters of stars
Which planet in our solar system has the most circular orbit?
In 1700 AD, this person showed that a series of 0s and 1s could be used to denote a number:

If perfect numbers, except 6, can be expressed by the sum of the cubes of an unbroken sequence of consecutive odd integers, what are the consecutive odd integers which, when cubed, give the perfect number 28?

Which of the following is responsible for the changing of the seasons in North America: W) the Earth's orbit is elliptical X) the Sun moves through space Y) the Earth's axis is not perpendicular to the ecliptic Z) the Earth's axis precesses
question.solution: Y) THE EARTH'S AXIS IS NOT PERPENDICULAR TO THE ECLIPTIC

question.problem: Which of the following most closely approximates the weight of a 1999 United States nickel: W) 1.9 grams X) 2.9 grams Y) 5.9 grams Z) 8.9 grams
question.solution: Y) 5.9 GRAMS Sample Round Robin Page 11

question.problem: Which of the following is an example of a buffer system: W) H2CO3 and water X) H2CO3 and NaHCO3 Y) NH3 and N2 Z) NaCl and KCl
Convert -40F into Centigrade:
Which of the following particles has not yet been observed but is generally theorized to exist: W) mesons X) gluons Y) fermionic hadrons Z) gravitons
With regard to the speed at which sound travels in a specific medium, at standard temperature and pressure, order the following materials from the SLOWEST to the FASTEST: steel, wood, air, water.
question.solution: AIR, WATER, WOOD, STEEL (Solution: air~331 m/sec; water~500 m/sec; wood~4300 m/sec; steel~5000 m/sec) Sample Round Robin Page 12 Sample Round Robin Page 13

question.problem: A newborn babys immunity, which is acquired from the mother, is often referred to as: W) active immunity X) passive immunity Y) bistander immunity Z) physical immunity
Parkinsons disease is caused by a lack of this neurotransmitter in the brain:
